intro: Saussurea kudoana var. yuparensis, commonly known as the Yuparén saussurea, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its arid environment. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat.
